instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 powers off with the keyboard but not with it .
threads.message: Am working on an 820-00165 board that would only power off with the power button , but when I try to power it back on with the same power button , it does not respond , even though SMC_ON/OFF_L  as well as PM_PWRBTN_L drops when I press the power button , still nothing happens. I have replaced the SMC but no changes , where else can I check ? am hoping I do not have to worry about the CPU/PCH , please help guys

threads.title: 820-00165 powers off with the keyboard but not with it .
threads.message:
Check what happens with SMC_RESET_L at same time.
Did you try the board alone on the desk?

threads.title: 820-00165 powers off with the keyboard but not with it .
threads.message: I did try the board alone on the work desk, SMC_RESET_L signal drops at the same time as SMC_ON/OFF_L when I press the button

threads.title: 820-00165 powers off with the keyboard but not with it .
threads.message:
Shoudn't drop.
Looks like U5110 issue, check voltage on pins 6; should stay high.

threads.title: 820-00165 powers off with the keyboard but not with it .
threads.message: I had already replaced U5110 before now , but no changes

threads.title: 820-00165 powers off with the keyboard but not with it .
threads.message:
I said to check pin 6 voltage.
If stays low, U5110 will do a SMC reset when pressing power button.

threads.title: 820-00165 powers off with the keyboard but not with it .
threads.message: PIN 6 stays high, so I try to remove the keyboard/trackpad connector and tried it without it , and it worked , so I just replaced it. thank you so much for your help. The issue is now resolved.
